p: P.S. I've heard nothing more about natal. This outfit usually gives short notice. I don't expect to go for sometime.
it was wonderful to hear today form you. So glad that you are getting results from the doctor's treatments.

I keep thinking that I'll drop in by appointment to see H. S. Latham on my Tuesday off, but I've been simply starved for rest on every off day (Tuesdays) for a long while. Dr. Katz is giving me the best possible treatment and I am clearing up in the bronchial glands quite a lot, but it is a case of much time being required to dry up the horrible condition. Faithful ol' Long Island climate brought the chronic condition to a climax. I was examined yesterday & Doc says he is satisfied with everything, but that I must be under this medicine for 3 or 4 months, 6 capsules daily, before all will be normal.
It is great to really know you have a thing under control. So, probably you & I both will be doin' allright before long.

She's a mad rush at A.A. these days! 10 more new planes, Douglas C-54's, largest cargo in production at the moment, are now under our care. I & my helpers keep very busy. I do almost nothing but diagnosis & the seeing to it that the remedy is carried out with strictness. The extremely complicated electrical circuits of present day aircraft are definitely understood and almost faultlessly handled by me. The lead mechanic on instruments & electrical has been shifted to a different crew because our crew has no need for him. Its all in my lap. the four electrician-instrument men under me call me 'boss' & we cuss each other up & down 8 hours daily, all in fun!
No telling what will come of it all. Anyway, to do well is a great satisfaction. Where one will end out in such a peculiar set-up as a today's aircraft maintenance man - noone knows.

a big pile of B.S. Union graft plus the airlines taking advantage of government economy measures etc. makes it not too good from a financial point of view. However, I should have a very decent salary within a short time. A.L.M.A., airline mechanics association, to which I belong, promises a nice raise soon in addition to the raise which will accompany my early promotion. So, having stayed in the buggy, (altho' very disgusted at times) appears now as much worthwhile.

I am so happy over the cycle in one volume - now actually to materialize. Also the Book of The Month & Pulitzer prize angles i feel should be likelihoods. We shall all be hoping & praying for things to 'click' in an honest-to-God way.
Preacher friend J. Donald Johnston & wife were with us last eve, & we talked about the cycle & collected poems.
This week I'll phone Latham & do my best to arrange a visit with him, for the following Tuesday.
